summary: Brings my Minimalist Renaming scheme to food... using a variation of Better Food by Wke113.
descriptionHtml:
[center][size= +4]Minimalist Renaming[/size][/center]
[center][size= +1]for better sorting[/size][/center]

[center][size= +2]Better Food Edition[/size][/center]
[heading]Description[/heading]
This was a very quick and simple mod to help organize items together, I didn't want the whole line taken up, so i simplified to one or two letters.

I separated food, since there are many food mods out there and renaming them would have overwritten the new values.

The values for the food in this mod used Wke113's [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/32911/?]Better Food[/url] as a starting point. I added support for from all DLC's, and modified some of the value's though.

In essence, most raw ingredients like vegetables and flour only restore 5 points of health. Most raw meat will restore Health and Stamina for 15-30 depending on size and cooked food will restore about double the raw amount. More complex recipes have a larger benefit.

There are a few recipes that are quite powerful, restoring 2 points of health, stamina or magicka for up to 15 minutes, these are general made in an oven, since i believe they are rather hard to find.

Some of the values are rather random, this mod is not meant to be realistic, just to make food an alternative to potions for some people.

As for the renaming, All food is prefaced with either, F: U: or F: C: for Food, cooked or uncooked.
I also added what the food increases, so if you have a lot of food, you can decide quickly what to use.

The letters in Parenthese mean
H - restores a flat mount of health
S - Restores a flat amount of Stamina
M - Restores a flat amount of Magicka

one of these with a + means that stat is fortified.
one of these a > means that stats gets restored over time.
a + by itself means some other stat is fortified. like Bows.

author: Morgaloth
